gmo_stance: Ban
notes: Prohibits GMO seed imports and cultivation; strict biosafety rules.

gmo_stance: Allows cultivation of GM soybean, maize, and cotton (very high adoption).
notes: Regulator: CONABIA under the Secretariat of Bioeconomy; SENASA handles food/feed safety; legal framework since 1991.

gmo_stance: Cultivates GM cotton (since 1996), GM canola (since 2003), and GM safflower (2018).
notes: Regulators: OGTR (environmental release), FSANZ (food).

gmo_stance: Ban
notes: Safeguard clause against MON810; ban maintained.

gmo_stance: First country to cultivate Bt brinjal (eggplant) starting 2013/2014; expansion continues via BARI varieties.
notes: Regulators: National Committee on Biosafety (NCB) and Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change; BARI implements deployment.

gmo_stance: Allows cultivation of GM soybean, maize, cotton, canola, eucalyptus, sugarcane; one of the largest GMO producers globally.
notes: Approvals managed by CTNBio (National Biosafety Technical Commission); commercialization requires inter-ministerial approval.

gmo_stance: Allows cultivation of GM canola, maize, soybean, sugar beet, alfalfa, others.
notes: Regulators: CFIA (environmental safety), Health Canada (food safety). First approval: herbicide-tolerant canola in 1995.

gmo_stance: Cultivates Bt cotton; has biosafety certificates for GM rice and maize but no commercial cultivation. Approves many GM crops for import (soy, maize, canola).
notes: Regulator: Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs (MARA).

gmo_stance: Ban
notes: 2008 Constitution prohibits GMO cultivation; limited exceptions.

gmo_stance: No commercial GM crop cultivation; imports GM foods/feeds permitted; cultivation ban since 2012 decree.
notes: Regulators: Ministry of Agriculture/Egyptian Biosafety bodies; food/feed per standard import rules.

gmo_stance: Only GE crop cultivated is Bt cotton (approved 2018); additional GE work under research/CFTs.
notes: Regulator: Environment, Forest and Climate Change Commission (biosafety).

gmo_stance: EU allows cultivation of one GM crop (MON810 maize) in Spain and Portugal; imports and processes many GM crops for feed/food.
notes: Regulators: EFSA (risk assessment), European Commission (approval), Council/Member States (vote). Cultivation bans in several member states.

gmo_stance: Ban
notes: Safeguard clause banning MON810 maize cultivation.

gmo_stance: Ban
notes: Banned MON810 cultivation (2009); continues to prohibit GM cultivation.

gmo_stance: Ban
notes: Safeguard clause banning MON810 maize cultivation.

gmo_stance: Ban
notes: Declared GMO-free; prohibits MON810 cultivation.

gmo_stance: Allows cultivation of Bt cotton; no other GM crops approved for commercial cultivation. GM mustard cleared in 2022 but contested; Bt brinjal moratorium since 2010.
notes: Regulator: Genetic Engineering Appraisal Committee (GEAC) under Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change.

gmo_stance: Ban
notes: Decree banning MON810 maize cultivation (2013); later upheld by court.

gmo_stance: Bt cotton commercial since 2020; government moved to enable GM food crops (Bt maize) though court cases continued in 2023.
notes: Regulator: National Biosafety Authority (NBA).

gmo_stance: Cultivates GM cotton; GM maize cultivation remains restricted/contested; large importer of GM maize/soy.
notes: Regulators: SENASICA (field releases), COFEPRIS (food/feed). Ongoing policy actions on GE corn since 2020.

gmo_stance: No commercial GM crop cultivation historically; GM foods permitted after FSANZ assessment. Government announced reforms in 2024 to end the outside-lab ban by end-2025 (process ongoing).
notes: Regulators: MPI (food labelling in NZ context), FSANZ (food approvals), EPA/HSNO for environmental releases (reform underway).

gmo_stance: Commercial approvals for GM maize, cowpea and cotton
notes: NBMA oversees biosafety; TELA maize commercially released in 2024 after prior environmental release.

gmo_stance: Cultivates GM soybean, maize and cotton with very high adoption in soybean.
notes: Regulators: SENAVE/MAG; biotech adoption expanded mid-2000s onward.

gmo_stance: Restrictive
notes: Moratorium on GM crops (2011) extended to 2035.

gmo_stance: GE corn cultivated since 2002; Golden Rice got commercial propagation permit in 2021 and Bt eggplant in 2022; in Apr 2024 the Court of Appeals revoked Golden Rice’s propagation permit and halted Bt eggplant release.
notes: Regulator: Department of Agriculture – Bureau of Plant Industry (DA-BPI); biosafety under Joint Department Circular No. 1 (2021).

gmo_stance: Ban
notes: Banned cultivation of MON810 maize and Amflora potato (2013).

gmo_stance: Restrictive
notes: Ban on GMO cultivation; imports allowed case-by-case (2016).

gmo_stance: Restrictive
notes: Cultivation banned; some imports require GMO-free certificates (wheat, barley, feed).

gmo_stance: Allows cultivation & import of GM maize, soybean, and cotton under the GMO Act
notes: Permits via Registrar; decisions by Executive Council; implementation via DALRRD.

gmo_stance: Moratorium
notes: National moratorium on GMO cultivation since 2005; extended to 2025.

gmo_stance: Restrictive
notes: No commercial GM cultivation; confined field trials only.

gmo_stance: Restrictive
notes: No GM crop cultivation; imports tightly regulated.

gmo_stance: Allows cultivation of GM soybean, maize, cotton, canola, alfalfa, sugar beet, papaya, squash, apple, potato, others.
notes: Regulators: USDA-APHIS (planting), EPA (pesticides), FDA (food/feed safety). First approvals mid-1990s.

gmo_stance: Cultivates GM soybean and maize; predictable approval system.
notes: Regulator: MGAP/CONBIO (events approved since 1998–2011+).

gmo_stance: Ban
notes: Government prohibited GM crop cultivation (2004).

gmo_stance: Only GE corn is cultivated; approvals started 2014–2016, resumed 2023; area surpassed 100k ha in 2020 and ~220k ha in 2023 (industry est.).
notes: Regulator: MARD (cultivation approvals) and MONRE (biosafety); imports/food-feed approvals also maintained.

gmo_stance: Ban
notes: Rejected GMO maize food aid (2002); long-standing restrictive stance.
